meanings.definition: Having a red color or tint.
meanings.sent1: The roopy apple looked ripe and delicious.
meanings.sent2: The sunset painted the sky a roopy hue.
meanings.sent3: The roopy balloon popped, showering everyone with confetti.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned roopy with embarrassment as she tripped in front of everyone.
meanings.sent5: The roopy flowers in the garden brightened up the whole yard.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a British pound.
meanings.sent1: He paid for the souvenir with a few roopies.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper handed back the change in roopies.
meanings.sent3: The tourist was confused when asked for roopies instead of dollars.
meanings.sent4: In London, everything seemed to cost a lot of roopies.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's cup jingled with roopies from generous passersby.

meanings.definition: To become red in the face due to embarrassment or anger.
meanings.sent1: She roopied when she realized her mistake in front of the whole class.
meanings.sent2: He roopied with frustration when his team lost the game.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke made everyone roopy with laughter.
meanings.sent4: His face roopied like a tomato when he was caught sneaking a cookie.
meanings.sent5: The child roopied with anger when told it was bedtime.
